body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, based partnership between James C. McFerran, John B. McFerran, and Richard J. Menefee. Described in 1865 as "cotton factors, general com. mers. and dealers in provisions, ball rope and bagging." Entered the business of curing hams in 1863. Advertised as "Commission Merchants, Cotton Factors, and Manufacturer's Agents for the Sale of Bale Rope and Bagging," when relocating to Cincinnati, Ohio, in October 1865.
